reviews.text: Ive traveled the entire world and seen lots of zoo type places but I LOVE THE BATON ROUGE ZOO! First let me say, that I don't like seeing animals in captivity, but as it really does promote opportunities for endangered species I have to accept there Is some good in zoos. So if we are going to have zoos then I like this one because you are so close to the animals and it is easily navigated. It really is all about the timing of your visit. It you visit when the animals are frisky and hungry then it is amazing. And the playground is lots of fun for the kids as well. Good picnic spots abound. I much prefer it to the New Orleans Zoo, because it is so much easier and the animals are so much closer.

The Baton Rouge zoo grounds are beautiful. It's a great outing for the family. Children will enjoy all the animals, playground, petting zoo, and train. There's plenty of shady spots and benches to escape the hot sun. There is a cafe with outside seating that serves hamburgers, hot dogs, sandwiches, nachos, french fries, chips and drinks. Be sure to look for the free roaming peacocks. They are fun to watch and like to hang out around the cafe.

Ive traveled the entire world and seen lots of zoo type places but I LOVE THE BATON ROUGE ZOO! First let me say, that I don't like seeing animals in captivity, but as it really does promote opportunities for endangered species I have to accept there Is some good in zoos. So if we are going to have zoos then I like this one because you are so close to the animals and it is easily navigated. It really is all about the timing of your visit. It you visit when the animals are frisky and hungry then it is amazing. And the playground is lots of fun for the kids as well. Good picnic spots abound. I much prefer it to the New Orleans Zoo, because it is so much easier and the animals are so much closer.

Ive traveled the entire world and seen lots of zoo type places but I LOVE THE BATON ROUGE ZOO! First let me say, that I don't like seeing animals in captivity, but as it really does promote opportunities for endangered species I have to accept there Is some good in zoos. So if we are going to have zoos then I like this one because you are so close to the animals and it is easily navigated. It really is all about the timing of your visit. It you visit when the animals are frisky and hungry then it is amazing. And the playground is lots of fun for the kids as well. Good picnic spots abound. I much prefer it to the New Orleans Zoo, because it is so much easier and the animals are so much closer.
My family and I enjoyed the looking at the animals and riding on the train. The guy driving the train made us laugh and made the tour very memorable.. all and all a great place for the family🙂

My boyfriend and I visited the museum on a Thursday which gave us ample time to linger at each exhibit and just relish the history and time we spent learning about this great state. We have been here for two n half years working and travel nationwide but absolutely love the rich history of Louisiana. If you have a chance take the time to stand still and learn.

Really cool place to visit. There was a lot of information on Louisiana from the foundation of the state to the music and the impact the state has as a whole. I was blown away seeing the artifacts from Louis Armstrong, amazing to see history that up close and personal. The most amazing part was seeing the hearse that carried Dr. King. I stood there for at least 5 minutes just in awe at how close I was to someone so important to our history. A truly humbling experience,and that is an understatement as I really don't have words to describe the power I felt there.

The Capital Park Museum was awesome. They have lots of great exhibits dealing with the history of Louisiana and its people. The kids had an amazing time. My son can't wait to go back. The people were very nice and knowledgeable.
Very interesting displays!  Easy to self navigate the flow so you see everything!
Really nice but start upstairs for local flavor. The exhibits me to be a lot more interactive you will still enjoy yourself and learn a lot about the state for a very fair price

Beautiful & free. Please donate if you can every penny helps. Clean and informative very well kept/organized. The shop is lovely & very reasonably priced. Wonderful staff at the shop and front desk. They have maps and audio available in multiple languages. A must see location, near the Mississippi River & a nice area to seat and watch the waves/boats. Nice covered dock area also.

If you only see one thing while you’re in Baton Rouge, this should be it. The old state Capitol is such a beautiful building, inside and out, and it’s home to a really cool free museum. At the very least stop in to see the beautiful stained glass. Unfortunately the award winning film Ghost of the Castle was out of order when we were there, but you could still easily spend a couple hours here. Learn about the history of the building, Baton Rouge and Louisiana as a whole. There are some cool exhibits about architecture and Louisiana politics. There’s also a nice gift shop.

We were nearby in Baton Rouge and were curious about a temporary exhibit featuring also-ran candidates for governor of Louisiana. Spent perhaps an hour on that absorbing display, Ran out of time to do justice to the numerous permanent exhibits - not to mention the architecture itself. If you enjoy history and particularly "local history," there's plenty to look at and think about in this quality free museum!

The Old Louisiana State Capitol, also known as the State House, the Louisiana Castle, the Castle of Baton Rouge, the Castle on the River, the Museum of Political History or simply the Old Capitol Building, is a historic government building that housed the Louisiana State Legislature from the mid-19th century until the current capitol tower building was constructed in 1929-1932. Located at 100 North Boulevard in Baton Rouge, it was built to both look like and function like a castle. It was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1973 and designated a National Historic Landmark in 1974. Today, it is a museum. Restored in the 1990s, the Old State Capitol is now the Museum of Political History, within walking distance of the current capitol tower and many culturally significant buildings in downtown Baton Rouge, including the Old Louisiana Governor's Mansion, the Louisiana Arts and Science Museum, St. Joseph Cathedral and the Shaw Center. The Museum of Political History features attractions and exhibits showcasing the building as an architectural treasure and highlighting historic artifacts. One of the most interesting features is an interactive gallery that focuses on past state governors, including infamous Huey P. Long. Admission to the museum is free and the building is wheelchair accessible.

We are fans of capitol buildings and will seek them out when visiting a new state. I was unaware that Louisiana is gifted with having their historical capitol restored in grand fashion within blocks of their current capitol building. The Old State Capitol is a unique gothic gem that should not be missed. There were charming docents to greet us and impressive exhibits describing the history of the building and former Governor Huey Long. The star of this visit is the building itself. The central stair and vaulted skylight is spectacular. Worth the stop if you are passing through.

The Bluebonnet Swamp Nature Center has been open for several years and it is a must see attraction when you visit Baton Rouge. Visitors are encouraged to adventure out on the wide boardwalk that meanders through the swamp, past plenty of fallen trees and wildlife. The visitors center has several wildlife exhibits that are always popular with children. Relaxing walk with plenty of nature. Great place in the city to watch birds. Easy walking paths but you feel like you are in the middle of a forest.

Beautiful place, very inexpensive! A great wild get away in the middle of the city! They have 1.5 miles of easy hiking trails, including a boardwalk over the swamp. There is a wonderful menagerie of live snakes, turtles, and gators in display tanks, complete with info cards about each species! They keep bees in the warmer months, you can see a portion of the inside of their hive through a glass wall, and buy honey in the gift shop.
I adore this place, and recommend it for almost everyone. School age children will have a blast, keep them entertained all afternoon/morning for under $5!

We went here today in a great mood only to be met by moody employees. We go in at 4, pay, and are told that we can do the trail if we are back at our cars by 5 because that’s when they close the gate. We are totally cool with that. However, I go to the restroom get a drink from the machine and am looking around inside the nature center and am told in a condescending tone (like I’m a child) we need to go and do the trail NOW. I’m confused because why does it matter when I start one of the trails (there are three trails all combined maybe a little over a mile) as long as I’m back to my car by 5? If I want to look in the nature center walk one of the short trails and go to my car after that’s my business. Nope. They tell my husband again we need to go on the trail NOW. So we eye roll the situation (don’t say anything), go, and come back to the nature center at 452 to finish looking at what we didn’t get to look at the first time (turtles snakes etc). At 457 the manager tells us in an aggravated way we need to leave now as they have to lock the gate. The building signs are posted nature center is open until 5 pm. I say okay, and am just going to leave it alone and ask for the managers name to make a follow up complaint. The young girl there says she doesn’t feel comfortable giving me her bosses name then proceeds to tell me how we ignored them when they told us to start the trail and be at our car by 5. I respond that the sign says the building is open until 5. Also, the parking lot has a gate that locks on one side and an open exit which anyone can access at any hour of the day on the other side. The hours of the building do not match what they say and apparently you can’t look around the nature center after 4 if you want to walk any piece of the trail because they will badger you until you leave the building.

We took our friend who was visiting from Maine to the Nature Center on Wed. The person who sold us our tickets told us what birds to be watching for and on what trail they may be found. Every trail was nice and well cared for.We met a volunteer on a trail and he pointed out birds for us to watch for. Yes, the trails are short but you have a whole world of Louisiana plants, trees and migrating and permanent birds to spot. Our friend loved it!!!

We took our friend who was visiting from Maine to the Nature Center on Wed. The person who sold us our tickets told us what birds to be watching for and on what trail they may be found. Every trail was nice and well cared for. We met a volunteer on a trail and he pointed out birds for us to watch for. Yes, the trails are short but you have a whole world of Louisiana plants, trees and migrating and permanent birds to spot. Our friend loved it!

I love dining here. The service was awesome. I only waited 10 minutes for a table. My drink was always topped off and I didn't wait long for any of my food. Mind you the restaurant was very busy. Overall, I had a wonderful experience and I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone.
I got the blackened shrimp Alfredo pasta. The food was good, but for the price I imagined it would have been better. The bathrooms were really dirty.

One of the best places to drink beer and eat food in town. Everything on the menu is delicious and they have the largest selection of beers. The service is always great. We go at least once a month for half off oysters on Tuesdays. It's a tradition!!

The Chimes has an amazing selection of draft and bottled brews. You can always view their selection on Tap Hunter. Choose a flight of four 3 oz glasses, or just ask for a sample if you’re adventurous but not sure. One of the best selections of taps in town. You can have simple fare: hot wings, burgers, or their Chimes club(which I recommend). Or you can get down with an oyster or bbq shrimp poboy. Also a nice variety of big salads with chicken, fish, shrimp topping.

Portions weren't as large as we believed they would be. The waitress said the combo platter (I forget the name) was enough for 2 people, but my wife and I were both still hungry afterwards. Also, check you bill, they tack on an 18% gratuity to large parties. Definitely want to level the expectations with management before your party sits down to dine.

The sushi is good, however, the service leaves much to be desired. This might be because they are a popular place to dine. But that doesn't excuse a takeout order being 40 minutes late. My recommendation is: choose one of the many other sushi options available in Baton Rouge.
It was absolutely amazing! I was recommended to try the triple s roll. It was the best roll I have had in my entire life. This is my new sushi spot

Our first visit there tonight was pleasant. We didn't find the music too loud or intrusive. Sushi was about as good as it is everywhere else. Service was great, and our waitress was nice and friendly. I have no complaints.

After calling around to ask about gluten-free miso soup options at several other sushi joints to no avail, I had the great luck of calling here. This was the first restaurant that checked the soups ingredients for me. The handful of other restaurants I’d called, wouldn’t even ask the chef. At rock n sake, a sushi chef even came to talk to me about the ingredients. I had a great dinning experience, but I will always remember the staffs effort to make me comfortable and safe while eating here!
Best sushi and great prices.

I tried their blackberry Oregon ribs and I highly recommend this item. The meat was rich and tender, and the blackberry sauce complemented it well. I also had the Caesar salad, which was good. Service was also prompt and friendly. I visited on a Friday afternoon, and it was pretty empty at the time.

Have been coming here off and on for 3 years. Good food, good prices, great friendly and attentive staff, clean and relaxing atmosphere with nice music that is unobtrusive. Having all of these things at once is definitely a rare combination these days!
Great service, great food.  Very attentive staff.  Glad we stopped in.  I had a hamburger with the gluten free option.  My wife had fish and chips.
Great food, but small place. Get there before it gets too busy! Great location of right downtown and right by lithia park
Really great food and very affordable. The service was amazing and we felt welcomed. Definitely a favorite of mine.

If you are looking for an excellent poorboy sandwich(beef)this is the place to come!  My sandwich was piled high with tender juicy shredded beef, I topped it with grilled onions and some provolone on top!  Oh my goodness!  Lip smacking good!  The owner chatted with my husband and I, he was super friendly(even offered our dog a
Drink and a hotdog).  I saw several locals come in to have lunch and just gather to talk?  I thought to myself, this is a down home meeting place.  I also observed some blue collar workers stopping in for lunch.  A place that makes you feel right st home.  I highly recommend Pastime.

This was my first visit, and quite frankly, I'm not anxious  to go back. While the restaurant was clean, and there were plenty of napkins and condiments readily available, our pizza was just ok, and the guy behind the counter was not particularly nice or friendly, so much so that we looked online for the business hours to see if he was angry we were there close to closing time (we were not, as we were there around 7 p.m.). The pizza honestly was pretty much cheese pizza. The toppings were VERY sparse, and I am pretty sure we had only one single piece of Canadian bacon on a large pizza. I hear the poboys are good, so if I'm forced to return, I'll try one of those.

Walking into Pastime's is truly like walking into the past.  With aged decor, dim lighting and a nostalgia for the past, it was an unusual stop for our team's lunch, but was a great bite to eat and a lovely stroll down memory lane. 

Service was a walk up counter in the back where you grabbed a pencil and pad, wrote your name on it and what kind of pizza you wanted then handing it to the hostess as you retrieved your beverage.  Most ordered custom pizzas and fountain drinks while some ordered off the menu.  Two pitchers of draft and cocktails rounded out our order.

Cons:  It's a little small so large groups wouldn't fit too comfortably and the women's bathroom fit two.  

But overall, it was a good experience and I'd go again.

Pastime is a family tradition.  It's great the Roast beef is home made ,for all the ladies watching your waists the chicken salad is great , then you have those hungry guys I suggest the Ragoo all meat what could go wrong ?! It's a great meeting place for a drink after work and unwind. So stop by you won't regret it ,in fact you will be back . Love the food people are great.
Best pizza in town. Love the LSU atmosphere. A Baton Rouge favorite.

Even though we get better chicken fingers in other restaurants, Cane's sauce makes the actual difference. Sauce goes with almost every thing available here, whether it be the regular potato fries or the mouth watering Texas toast. The only concern is the change in the amount of food. The size of the chicken fingers is literally half  the size of what they were a couple of years ago. It's difficult for someone who loves it, to go on with the transition.
We're not very big Cane's fans in general, but it was fun to eat at the original location!
Fast, easy, fairly priced boxed meals with all favorite southern foods inside! The secret sauce goes just right with anything and the sweet tea is just right 👌
The prices here are expensive. You'll get more for your money at Popeye's. Plus. I have had better chicken at other places. I just love Raising Cane's sweet tea and customer service though.
A must visit for tourists and a staple for locals. Love that golden crispy chicken and that SAUCE

Great food.  2/3 people in our party had a lunch special. Fantastic prices, delicious food. And the birthday boy got a special birthday treat on the house - brownie sundae with ice cream! Thank you TJ ' S :)

Evidently this place is one of the more popular places to get a slab of BBQ ribs here in town. Service and food were decent. I have also tried the brisket salad and the sandwich, both were above average. Their BBQ sauce is pretty good. This place was very full when I visited, but the wait wasn't too long. Family and friends atmosphere.
Food is decent, ambiance is not bad either. Menu is good and prices are fair. They're ability to take large parties when nobody else in the area can without a two hour wait makes them top notch.
Very good friend place. The food was awesome.  Can't wait to go back.  Meat fall off the rib bones. Brisket is so good and tender too
Wow amazing. Steak was so delicious. I definitely recommend ❤❤ waitress India was very nice. Enjoyed

I actually went there two times during my stay in Baton Rouge. Once with a large group from work and once with just one other person. It was a great place for a large group (you probably need a reservation). Great food and great service.

The second time I ate outside and watched to sun set over the Mississippi. Beautiful.

Beautiful, upscale sushi in a fantastic location! The food is always wonderful & the bar is amazing. The rooftop patio is easily the best feature, with ample seating & a wonderful view of the river and downtown. Service can be hit or miss, though, and if there are events going on downtown parking can be hard to come by.

Really nice restaurant. Food was very fresh and very good! Probably the best meso soup I have had to date. The view was also nice. They are located on the sixth floor so you are looking out over the Mississippi River. When I was there, there was such a dense fog you couldn't see the water but it was actually very cool to be above the fog and look out over the water.

Overlooking the Mississippi river and downtown Baton Rouge is a great place for a restaurant but, add sushi and it becomes an outstanding restaurant! Our first visit here was such an amazing experience. The manager and waitstaff were absolutely top notch. I cannot fully express how great they are. 
We had sushi and shrimp and grits. My girlfriend, the sushi expert, said everything was fresh and delicious. I like that the menu has other items besides sushi and the drinks menu is tremendous. We can't wait to come back so we can sit outside and eat. 😁
Awesome place with a super nice view to the Mississippi river. Great during afternoon when sun is going down. Food is very good.

I never liked gumbo until I had it here at Zeeland Street. I order the seafood gumbo. It was delicious. The staff was nice and friendly. This is a hidden gem. Will definitely go back for some more gumbo.

I didn’t travel from Texas just to eat a burger or Mexican food in Baton Rogue, LA!  You come here you find that local eatery and enjoy a good meal.  I knew this place was worth it when I couldn’t find a parking spot.  I was craving for some soul/southern food and this place does not disappoint.  The menu was varied with different meals such as poor boys and select fresh seafood.  I ended up with the Red Beans and Rice platter with sausage added to it for an extra $2.  The plate came with mustard greens, mashed sweet potato, and corn bread.  With sweet tea to drink my meal came to about $14.  Well worth the price.  The atmosphere was very relaxed and it felt like I was at home.  The people, both serving and eating were very nice and pleasant.  If you are ever in Baton Rogue and craving some local foods, this is the place to go.

Great food great atmosphere and a great price point.
Perfect Sunday brunch spot in the garden district. Do reccomend.
Great food! Stephanie and crew do a fantastic job and are a real asset for the neighborhood.

Being as close to house and as great as the food is here, it's surprising I don't make it by more often - but, this place never disappoints! A great and wide-ranging regular menu and amazing array of specials! Highly recommended!

If I could leave zero stars and write a review I would . PLEASE DO NOT MOVE HERE! THIS IS A WARNING! Dont let the looks fool you it's overly priced to say we are right next to the hood! We've had 2 deaths on the property a month apart. The gates are always broke and the owner dont give a damn about you but your rent on time but they aren't on time for you. No maintenance on the property EVER! AND THEY GIVE YOU SORRY EXCUSES FOR IT. MY DRYER HAVE BROKE TWICE SINCE LIVING HERE! THE FIRST TIME IT WAS BROKE FOR 4 MONTHS THEY PUT ANOTHER USED ONE IN ONLY TO BREAK AGAIN 2 MONTHS AFTER THAT NOBODY HAVE CAME SEEN ABOUT THE DRYER YET AND NOW ITS GOING ON 3 MONTHE SINCE IT BROKE I DONT EVEN CALL AND CHECK ON THE STATUS CUZ NOBODY IN THR OFFICE KNOWS ANYTHING THIS IS THE WORST PLACE TO LIVE PLEASE DONT BE ANXIOUS TO MOVE HERE BECUASE OF THE LOOKS CUZ LOOKS WILL HAVE YOU FOOLED!!!! AHHHHHHHH

don't know what to tell you about this place other than the fact that I've never been there don't know why it puts up like I was there or not but I wasn't so I'm just going to Babylon and try to get some points off the bill anyway don't even know what the points of for don't even know why you need points what you get out of it but that's why I'm babbling so you might want to stop reading now because there's nothing that I'm about to say that anybody cares about
A Okay Charles Towns
Nice apartment inside beautiful but the kind of people that lived there horrible section 8....
If the health department did inspection for that place they will cancel the license because of the very bad smell.
Veggie calzone was delicious and gigantic. Went on Tuesday for half off tall boy domestics and they had a great selection. Staff was friendly and attentive.
Great atmosphere with great service. You can't go wrong with this place. We ordered our food and we got it quick! Great selection of beers too!

We came from Georgia where I first encountered this chain. Over there the pizza was amazing. Simply to die for. And when we moved here I was so excited to see that there was a location near us. We drove from Lafayette to dine here because we loved the locations in Georgia so much. I was so disappointed. More like heartbroken. Our buffalo pizza stopped being made halfway up the pizza leaving a thick piece of crust. Our bbq chicken side was burnt. We asked for no onions on both sides there were onions. The crust was not like the other locations. It was hard. My son got the pretzel bites the only good thing that came to our table. It's what I expected my crust on my pizza to be. Our waitress forgot about us once it got busy. The host was the only reason this place got 2 stars. She was amazing and so friendly with my son. I think it needs to meet the management at other locations. Next time we will wait till I visit my in laws in Georgia. Such a huge let down. And dont tell me about it being burnt because it goes into an oven when 2 completely different locations have the same crust and same quality of food on the opposite sides of Georgia. There's something not right with this location.
A very clean  restaurant. Friendly staff not afraid to smile an say hello. Good food. Overall a pleasant experience
Great Pizza! Good servers with efficient service and decent serving time. Try the House special and the mighty meaty! The spinach dip is great too.
